snippet: The International Criminal Court said former President Laurent Gbagbo would be tried on charges of crimes against humanity in connection with violence after 2010 elections in Ivory Coast.
abstract: International Criminal Court orders former Ivory Coast Pres Laurent Gbagbo to stand trial; Gbagbo's refusal to accept electoral defeat in 2010 set off brief but bloody civil war.
lead_paragraph: The International Criminal Court said former President Laurent Gbagbo would be tried on charges of crimes against humanity in connection with violence after 2010 elections in Ivory Coast.

headline.main: Ex-Leader of Ivory Coast Is Ordered to Stand Trial
headline.print_headline: Ivory Coast: Court Orders Ex-President to Stand Trial

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
